title: Gulab Jamun
ingredients: For syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1 cup water, 4-5 cardamom pods, few saffron strands
instructions: Mix milk powder, flour, and baking soda in a bowl.
Add ghee and mix well, then add milk gradually to make soft dough.
Make small balls and keep aside.
Make sugar syrup with water, cardamom, and saffron.
Heat oil and deep fry the balls until golden brown.
Soak fried balls in warm syrup for 30 minutes.
Serve warm or cold.

title: Rasgulla
instructions: Boil milk and add lemon juice to curdle it.
Strain the whey and wash the paneer with cold water.
Knead paneer until smooth, make small balls.
Make sugar syrup with water and cardamom.
Boil the balls in syrup for 15-20 minutes.
Add saffron and let it cool.
Serve chilled.

title: Kheer (Rice Pudding)
instructions: Wash rice and soak for 30 minutes.
Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan.
Add rice and cook on low heat, stirring frequently.
Cook until rice is soft and milk thickens.
Add sugar, nuts, cardamom, and saffron.
Cook for 5 more minutes, add raisins.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Halwa (Carrot Halwa)
instructions: Grate carrots finely.
Heat ghee in a pan, add grated carrots.
Cook carrots until moisture evaporates.
Add milk and cook on low heat, stirring frequently.
Cook until milk reduces and carrots are soft.
Add sugar, nuts, cardamom, and saffron.
Cook until halwa thickens and ghee separates.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: North Indian Dessert Masters

title: Jalebi
ingredients: For syrup: 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup water, 1 tsp lemon juice, saffron strands
instructions: Mix flour, cornflour, and baking soda.
Add yogurt and water to make smooth batter.
Let batter rest for 30 minutes.
Make sugar syrup with water, lemon juice, and saffron.
Heat oil, pour batter in circular motion to make jalebi shapes.
Fry until golden and crispy.
Soak in warm syrup for 2-3 minutes, serve hot.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Indian Street Food Masters

title: Payasam (Kerala Style)
instructions: Heat ghee, roast vermicelli until golden.
Add coconut milk and cook until vermicelli is soft.
Add jaggery and stir until dissolved.
Add nuts, cardamom, cashews, and raisins.
Cook for 5 more minutes.
Serve warm or chilled.

title: Badam Halwa (Almond Halwa)
instructions: Peel soaked almonds and grind to smooth paste.
Heat ghee in a pan, add almond paste.
Cook on low heat, stirring continuously.
Add milk gradually and cook until thick.
Add sugar, cardamom, and saffron.
Cook until halwa thickens and ghee separates.
Garnish with pistachios and serve hot.

title: Ladoo (Besan Ladoo)
instructions: Heat ghee in a pan, add besan.
Roast besan on low heat until golden and fragrant.
Let it cool completely.
Add powdered sugar, nuts, cardamom, and raisins.
Mix well and shape into round ladoos.
Store in airtight container.
Serve as needed.

title: Ras Malai
instructions: Boil milk and add lemon juice to curdle it.
Strain whey and wash paneer with cold water.
Knead paneer until smooth, make flat discs.
Make sugar syrup with water and cardamom.
Boil paneer discs in syrup for 15 minutes.
Add saffron to remaining syrup.
Arrange discs in serving dish, pour syrup, garnish with pistachios.

title: Kulfi (Indian Ice Cream)
instructions: Boil milk in a heavy-bottomed pan.
Add condensed milk and sugar.
Cook on low heat, stirring frequently until thick.
Add nuts, cardamom, saffron, and rose water.
Let it cool completely.
Pour into kulfi molds or small containers.
Freeze for 4-6 hours. Serve frozen.

credit.display: Cooking Credits: Indian Frozen Dessert Specialists
